A cup is an open-top vessel (container) used to hold liquids for drinking, typically with a flattened hemispherical shape, and often with a capacity of about 100â€“250 millilitres (3â€“8Â USÂ flÂ oz). [4][5]

Wondering why there are different coffee cup types and what they're for? We discuss every type of coffee cup and their sizes in the following post.  With so many coffee mugs available, and different coffee cups recommended for different types of coffee, narrowing in on your ideal can be pretty daunting. TABLE SETTING GUIDE The cup is made in seven sizes, each with a different volume capacity: Breakfast cup; Mug; Teacup; Coffee cup; Chocolate cup; After-dinner coffee cup; and Demitasse cup.  Although the expression "cupful" denotes a half-pint serving...
